title: Apple Fruit Baskets
summary: Apple Fruit Baskets might be just the side dish you are searching for. This recipe serves 4 and costs $1.9 per serving. One serving contains 166 calories, 1g of protein, and 0g of fat. 45 people have made this recipe and would make it again. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free and dairy free diet. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 15 minutes. A mixture of licorice, club soda, fruit, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so tasty. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 44%. This score is good. Try Cookie Fruit Baskets, Banana Baskets, and Chicken in Baskets for similar recipes.
instructions: Start by cutting the top off of an apple. Use an apple corer or a metal spoon to scoop out the insides of the apple out leaving a quarter-inch intact around the outside. (You can dice the apple pieces that you scooped out and add them to the other diced fruit or use it for another purpose.)Carefully cut two notches into the sides of the apple, about the width of a piece of licorice, directly across from each other, without cutting the peel.Place the apples in a bowl and fill them with club soda, allowing them to soak for about 3 minutes.Pour out the club soda and insert the pieces of licorice into the cut-out notches.Fill the apple baskets with the diced fruit.Store in the fridge until ready to serve.

steps.step: Start by cutting the top off of an apple. Use an apple corer or a metal spoon to scoop out the insides of the apple out leaving a quarter-inch intact around the outside. (You can dice the apple pieces that you scooped out and add them to the other diced fruit or use it for another purpose.)Carefully cut two notches into the sides of the apple, about the width of a piece of licorice, directly across from each other, without cutting the peel.
Place the apples in a bowl and fill them with club soda, allowing them to soak for about 3 minutes.
Pour out the club soda and insert the pieces of licorice into the cut-out notches.Fill the apple baskets with the diced fruit.Store in the fridge until ready to serve.
